position.marginalia_text: { Aut seria vtilitas: aut merus iocus.

marginalia.translation: Either serious utility, or a mere game.

position.marginalia_text: | Nihil prosunt omnes scientia[e], et ornamenta, nisi viro.

marginalia.translation: All the sciences and ornaments are of use to nothing except man.

position.marginalia_text: Decet Consiliarium, esse fortiter prudentem: Ducem, esse prudenter forte.

marginalia.translation: It is fitting for a counsellor to be powerfully prudent and for a leader to be prudently powerful.

position.marginalia_text: Dies rerum, non terendus verbis. Tacitus.

marginalia.translation: A day of things, not to be spent with words. Tacitus.

position.marginalia_text: Ô temperantia Dea. Sed ô prudentia, Dearu[m] Dea.

marginalia.translation: O Goddess temperance. But, O prudence, goddess of goddesses.
A day of business, not to be spent with trifles.
The library of heaven, the museum of Astrophilus.

position.marginalia_text: Vir est, qui à Seipso dependet: et omnia spernit sui Cursus impedimenta. Quem nulla perturbationis, aut vllius offensionis nubes aliquo modo obscurat: semper illustrem, et

marginalia.translation: A man is he who depends on himself and spurns all impediments in his way, whom no cloud of disturbance or of any mishap can darken in any way; who, like the sun, is always illustrious and ever moving forward.

position.marginalia_text: Ingenium, ubi intenderis, valet: ubi extenderis, pra[e]ualet.

marginalia.translation: When you apply your intellect, it prevails; when you increase your intellect, it is even stronger.
